title: Flipped Learning-Based Self-Regulated Foreign Language Learning Design: Mobile Education for Mathematics Professionals

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: A learning process aimed at self-directed foreign language proficiency improvement in a smartphone-centered environment, with project-based assessments validating practical application skills.

learning_goals: Learners perform foreign language reading/writing tasks ≥3 times weekly using self-regulated learning strategies provided on the flipped learning platform
Learners produce a 3-minute foreign language presentation on a mathematics topic by Week 2, incorporating peer feedback and instructor coaching
Learners achieve the benchmark (≥70% accuracy) in assessing foreign language grammar and specialized terminology usage at course completion

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
